results.firPara: The round of 16 draw will take place on Monday, 12 December at 11am, and will be televised live by BT Sport.
results.secPara: Arsenal and Leicester City will both be seeded as group winners and are joined by the other top-placed finishers Napoli, Barcelona, Atlético Madrid, Monaco, Borussia Dortmund and Juventus.
results.webTitle: Champions League last 16: who can Arsenal, Leicester and Manchester City face next?

results.firPara: • Teenager scored a wonder goal against parent club in Champions League
results.secPara: Patrick Roberts said he has no regrets about joining Celtic on loan after an outstanding performance in the 1-1 Champions League draw with his parent club Manchester City and is determined to show he is capable of starring for Pep Guardiolas side.
results.webTitle: Patrick Roberts has no regrets about Celtic loan move from Manchester City

results.firPara: There was more at stake for Tottenham Hotspur than securing their place in the last 32 of the Europa League next February – the merits of which continue to feel dubious – and Mauricio Pochettino knew it. How else could his team selection have been explained?
results.secPara: The starting XI that he sent out was stronger than that which he had named in the previous Champions League tie away to Monaco, when the clubs hopes had been on the line. This time, Kyle Walker and Jan Vertonghen played, rather than Kieran Trippier and Kevin Wimmer – although Mousa Dembélé was rested. Christian Eriksen started and produced a man-of-the-match turn.
results.webTitle: Dele Alli breathes life into Tottenham to give them a Wembley win against CSKA

results.firPara: As chapters in a Champions League adventure go, this could hardly have been less romantic. Better sides than Leicester will fall at Estádio do Dragão, and it spoke warmly of their achievements that Claudio Ranieri could afford to field a skeleton lineup for what could have been their toughest Group G assignment, but the aftertaste was not meant to be this bitter.
results.secPara: The shame in this hammering, confirmed by two goals from André Silva either side of slick finishes from Jesús Corona and Yacine Brahimi before Diogo Jota completed the rout, is superficially slight but Porto could not have dreamed of more supine opposition against which to ensure their own progress to the round of 16. Any thoughts of a pick-me-up before the meeting with Manchester City on Saturday were exposed as fantasy and Ranieri was tellingly downbeat when reflecting on a night that only added to the impression of a malaise within his squad.
results.webTitle: Porto’s André Silva brings Leicester down to earth in final group game

results.firPara: MLS had more players in 2016 earning a six-figure weekly salary than Italys Serie A, according to research released this week.
results.secPara: The study, conducted by Verve Search, a marketing agency in London, and Axo Finans, a Norwegian financial consultant, found that 5% of players who earn a gross salary of €100,000 ($107,000) or more per week ply their trade in North America, as opposed to 3% in Italy.
results.webTitle: MLS has more high-earning players than Italy's Serie A, report finds

results.firPara: Spurs eased past a poor CSKA side to book their place in the knockout stage of the Europa League.
results.secPara: Wembley jinx? What Wembley jinx? Spurs ran out easy winners tonight it should have been a few more. Theyll play Europa League football in the New Year. And they wont be coming back here next season with a complex. A fine evenings work!
results.webTitle: Tottenham Hotspur v CSKA Moscow: Champions League – as it happened

results.firPara: The best that can be said about that from a Leicester perspective is that they fulfilled their fixture obligations. The performance was abysmal, as none of the fringe players cast into the starting lineup made any case for further inclusion. Porto are a nifty side and they had it easy today.
results.secPara: 90 min The ref will insist on playing at least three more minutes.
results.webTitle: Porto v Leicester City: Champions League – as it happened

results.firPara: José Mourinho says the pitch for Manchester Uniteds Europa League group match may require a miracle to be playable and has questioned why Uefa allowed their final tie, against Zorya, to be played in mid‑December in Ukraine.
results.secPara: A pitch inspection is scheduled at 10am local time but temperatures at Odessas Chornomorets Stadium are expected to plummet to -9C overnight. Mourinho believes the frozen pitch, which was covered on Wednesday evening, could prove too dangerous a surface to stage the game. United trained on a small section of of the pitch at around 7pm local time when the turf was rock hard.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho: Frozen pitch needs ‘miracle’ to be playable against Zorya

results.firPara: • Footballer appeared on 1997 Dispatches programme about sex abuse
results.secPara: A former youth footballer who spoke out two decades ago about Bob Higgins, the coach named in connection with allegations of historical sexual abuse, has expressed anger that the coach was allowed to continue to work in the game until now.
results.webTitle: Former Peterborough player expresses anger that Bob Higgins carried on coaching

results.firPara: José Mourinho and Henrikh Mkhitaryan were in no mood to admit it, yet winning the Europa League may be Manchester Uniteds best chance of Champions League qualification.
results.secPara: On offer for the winner of the continents second-tier competition is entry into next seasons European Cup and as Mourinho has previously claimed that is where United should be playing.
results.webTitle: Mourinho and Mkhitaryan target Europa League progress against Zorya
